tit.cmt: 単語の頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: 大和遠州流（やまとえんしゅうりゅう）は小堀遠州（政一）の三男小堀政伊に始まる小堀権十郎家に伝わった茶道の流派である。
sen.e: The Yamato Enshu school is one of Japanese tea ceremony schools headed by the Kobori Gonjuro family, which originated from Masai KOBORI, the third son of Enshu KOBORI (also known as Masakazu KOBORI).
sen.cmt: 原文に「小堀政一（政一）」とありますが、リンク先の用語と混ざっているようです。ウェブを確認し、「小堀遠州（政一）」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: The Yamato Enshu school is one of the Japanese tea ceremony schools headed by the Kobori Gonjuro family, which originated from Masai KOBORI, the third son of Enshu KOBORI (also known as Masakazu KOBORI).
sen.cmt: one of the Japanese tea ceremony schoolsとしました。Trans1コメントより、原文の一部を修正しました。
sen.e: The Yamato Enshu school is one of the Japanese tea ceremony schools headed by the Kobori Gonjuro family, which originated from Masai KOBORI, the third son of Enshu KOBORI (also known as Masakazu KOBORI).

sen.j: 小堀権十郎家は1000石の旗本。
sen.e: The Kobori Gonjuro family was a hatamoto (direct vassal of the shogun) family who had been given 1,000 koku of rice per year as a salary.
The Kobori Gonjuro family was a hatamoto (direct vassal of the shogun) family who had been given 1,000 koku of rice per year as a salary.
The Kobori Gonjuro family was a hatamoto (direct vassal of the shogun) family who had been given 1,000 koku of rice per year as a salary.
